Millions of Americans are falling into debt because they can't afford their prescription drugs.

A federal report I commissioned confirms it: poverty is killing our people.
 
A man in McDowell County, West Virginia, dies at 67—the same life expectancy as a man in India.
 
Just 350 miles away, in Fairfax, VA, a man lives to 82—the same as in Switzerland. This is just obscene. https://twitter.com/lfadulu/status/1171494088291446784 QT @lfadulu “A whole generation will be condemned to early death.” The Government Accountability Office finds that not only is the income gap growing between rich and poor, but the poor are living shorter lives and the rich are living longer. My latest: https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/10/us/politics/gao-income-gap-rich-poor.html

Some news you probably missed last week: the Trump administration is making another move to pollute our waters. I’m tired of this. I am proud to support the @UAW workers who are standing up to the greed of GM. Hispanic Americans have had a lasting impact on our nation’s history and success. We are stronger because of their contributions. Wishing you all a happy #HispanicHeritageMonth!

#HispanicHeritageMonth is a chance to celebrate the many contributions of Hispanic and Latinx communities throughout the United States. It's also a time to remember that the strength of our union is found in our diversity and our unity.
